intro: Dasyglossum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved dasyglossum, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dasyglossum longifolium is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
